channel.title: CVE Feed for Microsoft -- Windows 10 Version 1703
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Microsoft -- Windows 10 Version 1703

item.title: CVE-2019-0723|2024-07-23T17:27:27.117Z -- microsoft -- windows%2010%20version%201703
item.description: A denial of service vulnerability exists when Microsoft Hyper-V Network Switch on a host server fails to properly validate input from a privileged user on a guest operating system. An attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerability could cause the host server to crash. To exploit the vulnerability, an attacker who already has a privileged account on a guest operating system, running as a virtual machine, could run a specially crafted application that causes a host machine to crash. The update addresses the vulnerability by modifying how virtual machines access the Hyper-V Network Switch.

item.title: CVE-2019-0715|2024-07-23T17:30:06.391Z -- microsoft -- windows%2010%20version%201703
item.description: A denial of service vulnerability exists when Microsoft Hyper-V Network Switch on a host server fails to properly validate input from a privileged user on a guest operating system. To exploit the vulnerability, an attacker who already has a privileged account on a guest operating system, running as a virtual machine, could run a specially crafted application that causes a host machine to crash. The update addresses the vulnerability by modifying how virtual machines access the Hyper-V Network Switch.
